definition: to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: He said he could not bear such internal sabotage any longer.
sentences.chinese: 他说，他再也不能忍受这种内部的阴谋活动了。

sentences.english: She keeps after her boyfriend all day long and he can't bear it any more.
sentences.chinese: 她整天都在与她的男朋友争吵，他没法再忍受下去了。

sentences.english: and make that season of ice and snow more endurable.
sentences.chinese: 那歌声使冰天雪地的寒冬变得较易忍受。

sentences.english: How can you suffer such insolence?
sentences.chinese: 你怎能忍受这样的侮辱呢？

sentences.english: Without confirmed re-union, we may all find it hard to bear and wait.
sentences.chinese: 没有确定的重聚，我们也许都会觉得很难忍受分离。

sentences.english: His slight still sticks in my craw .
sentences.chinese: 他的侮辱仍然使我无法忍受。

sentences.english: This is intolerable, but it isn't an indictment of growth itself.
sentences.chinese: 这是难以忍受的，但它不能作为控诉经济增长的借口。

sentences.english: Not so long ago Japanese wives put up with any amount of infidelity and abuse.
sentences.chinese: 在不久前，日本的妻子们还忍受着各种背叛和虐待。
他能忍常人不能忍受的。

sentences.english: Worse than the total agony of being in love?
sentences.chinese: 还有比忍受爱情煎熬还要惨得事么？

sentences.english: I don't enjoy the pain, but I can live with it.
sentences.chinese: 我虽然不以疼痛为乐，但还可以忍受。

sentences.english: He can't stand this hot weather.
sentences.chinese: 他无法忍受这种热天气。

sentences.english: I found the woman scarcely endurable.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这个女人难以忍受。

sentences.english: The strongest man is the one who stands most alone .
sentences.chinese: 最坚强的人就是最能忍受孤独寂寞的人。

sentences.english: Sally is really hard. She can stand anything.
sentences.chinese: 萨莉真坚强，她能忍受一切。

definition: to endure/to bear with/to exercise patience/to restrain oneself/patience/endurance
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to suffer enough from/to suffer all kinds of/to have one's fill of
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
